title: Three Gloved Hand Killer deaths planned for Hollyoaks 20th anniversary week
text:
Three Gloved Hand Killer deaths planned for Hollyoaks 20th anniversary week Three Gloved Hand Killer deaths planned for Hollyoaks 20th anniversary week 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
The Gloved Hand Killer is set to strike again and claim three more victims, as part of a special week of 20th anniversary Hollyoaks episodes. 
The murderous storyline began earlier this year in January when Rick Spencer (played by Victor Gardener) was killed in hospital. 
Since then, psychotic Will Savage (James Atherton), Mariam Andrews (played by comedy actress Helen Lederer) and Phoebe McQueen (Mandeep Gill) have also fallen prey to the soap’s evil slayer. Hollyoaks’ Gloved Hand Killer wearing a mask (Lime Pictures) 
The killer will finally be revealed this month. 
To mark Hollyoaks’ 20th, viewers will also be treated to the soap’s first Gay Pride and a perilous underwater battle for Freddie (portrayed by Charlie Clapham), Jason (Alfie Browne-Sykes) and Robbie Roscoe (Charlie Wernham). 
Set in the fictional borough of Hollyoaks in Chester, Hollyoaks was first broadcast on Channel 4 on October 23, 1995. 
It started with just seven characters and now has almost 50. On its birthday it will have aired 4,240 episodes. 
Here’s what fans can look forward to as part of the celebrations (spoilers ahead). The Gloved Hand Killer is on the prowl Dr Charles S’avage, played by Andrew Greenough, is in trouble (Lime Pictures) 
Is this the end for Doctor S’avage? The medic (played by Andrew Greenough) is unaware of his perilous situation. Hollyoaks does Gay Pride Tony Hutchinson from Hollyoaks, played by Nick Pickard (Lime Pictures) 
Tony Hutchinson (played by Nick Pickard) decides to cash-in and throws Hollyoaks’ first ever gay pride festival. Harry (Parry Glasspool) and Ste (Kieron Richardson) at Gay Pride (Lime Pictures) 
Harry (Parry Glasspool) and Ste (Kieron Richardson) attend Hollyoaks Pride, the brainchild of businessman Tony. Drama at Hollyoaks Pride (Lime Pictures) 
Robbie and Jason run away from Trevor Royle (played by Greg Wood). Yes, there is a dramatic stunt Hollyoaks’ Roscoe brothers in trouble (Lime Pictures) 
Heart-stopping action as the Roscoe brothers jump off a viaduct and into a river to escape gun-toting Trevor. Hollyoaks’ Roscoe brothers (Lime Pictures) 
Will the siblings survive? James Redmond returns to Hollyoaks James Redmond returns to Hollyoaks (Lime Pictures) 
A familiar face is back as James Redmond revives the role of Rory ‘Finn’ Finnegan. The actor played Finn from 1997-2002 before departing for pastures new. He made a brief return in 2013. Share article 
The week-long 20th anniversary celebration is set to be a party Hollyoaks fans will long remember. Promoted Stories
